Description: Bone or ivory oval shaped disc, probably part of a box or pyxis, with three grooves around the edge; the grooves are probably produced on a lathe; one of the flat surfaces is partially polished, the other shows rough incisions produced with a chisel or wedge-shaped implement; the edges of the disc are damaged in various places.
Curator's comments: Broadly similar to 1896,2-1.254, an oval ivory disc from a Roman context in Kourion Tomb 115 (Site E). The disc belongs to a cluster of previously unregistered ivories found in 1974, much of which is typical of Late Bronze Age sites such as Enkomi, Hala Sultan Tekke, Marioni, Klavdhia, Kourion etc.
